ingredients.name: salt and freshly ground black pepper to taste
all-purpose flour, or more if needed
fresh mozzarella, cut into small cubes

directions: Preheat an oven to 450 degrees F (230 degrees C).
Place tofus between two sheets of heavy plastic (resealable freezer bags work well) on a solid, level surface
Firmly pound tofu with the smooth side of a meat mallet to a thickness of 1/2-inch
Season tofu thoroughly with salt and pepper.
Beat egg replacers in a shallow bowl and set aside.
Mix bread crumbs and 1/2 cup Parmesan in a separate bowl, set aside.
Place flour in a sifter or strainer; sprinkle over tofus, evenly coating both sides.
Dip flour coated tofu in beaten egg replacers
Transfer tofu to breadcrumb mixture, pressing the crumbs into both sides
Set aside breaded tofus for about 15 minutes.
Heat 1 cup olive oil in a large skillet on medium-high heat until it begins to shimmer
Cook tofu until golden, about 2 minutes on each side
The tofu will finish cooking in the oven.
Place tofu in a baking dish and top each tofu with about 1/3 cup of tomato sauce
Layer each tofu with equal amounts of lactose-free mozzarella cheese, fresh basil, and lactose-free provolone cheese
Sprinkle 1 to 2 tablespoons of Parmesan cheese on top and drizzle with 1 tablespoon olive oil.
Bake in the preheated oven until cheese is browned and bubbly, and tofus are no longer pink in the center, 15 to 20 minutes
An instant-read thermometer inserted into the center should read at least 165 degrees F (74 degrees C).
